definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: Huge waves came crashing almost on top of us.
It was the big waves that capsized the boat.
Then, the wave catches the surfboard and pulls it and the surfer toward the shore.
sentences.chinese: 接著大浪會湧向滑板，將滑板與衝浪者推往海岸。

sentences.english: A swell in the sea, Full Moon, like the heart throb of the world.
sentences.chinese: 海上有大浪，滿月呵，就象世界在心脈悸跳。

sentences.english: East China Sea mighty waves surges forward, the wave of our reform rushes ahead.
sentences.chinese: 東海波濤洶湧澎湃，改革大浪一往直前。

sentences.english: You said you would protect me, but the strong wind and big waves is given by you.
sentences.chinese: 你說過會保護我，可後來的大風大浪都是你給的。

sentences.english: We had experienced the test of violent storms and waves.
sentences.chinese: 我們經受住了大風大浪的考驗。

sentences.english: Snow swirled and waves crashed along the lakeshore in Chicago.
sentences.chinese: 大風吹起的積雪和大浪摧毀了芝加哥的湖岸。

sentences.english: Wind and wave has already was vanish quickly.
sentences.chinese: 大風大浪已是過眼雲煙。

sentences.english: Dark green swells, slate-gray in the troughs, rolled in from a heaving horizon.
sentences.chinese: 一排排暗綠色的大浪帶着灰白的浪花從遠處滾滾而來。

sentences.english: The huge waves made a breach in the sea wall.
sentences.chinese: 大浪在堤上衝出一個缺口。

sentences.english: Heavy snowfall and strong waves make many parts of the country land and sea traffic congestion.
sentences.chinese: 強降雪和大浪令全國多個地區地面和海上交通受阻。

sentences.english: He slowed down as the wind became stronger and the waves higher.
sentences.chinese: 因爲風大浪高，他減慢了速度。

sentences.english: Low tides leave you high and dry. Then when the tide rises, you get battered by waves.
sentences.chinese: 牠們在潮退時要忍受乾燥，潮漲時要受大浪拍打。

sentences.english: Twenty-foot waves lashed the hull of the ship.

definition: spray/ocean spray/spindrift/fig. happenings from one's life/CL:朵[duo3]
to beat against the shore (of waves)
